BUREAU OF CIVIL AVIATION SECURITY 
(MINISTRY OF CIVIL AVIATION) 
GOVERNMENT OF INDIA 
A WING , JANPATH  BHAWAN , 
JANPATH, NEW DELHI -110001 
Date: 31.01.2005 
 
AVSEC ORDER NO.   01/2005 
 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of Aircraft Act 1934, 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification 
No. 1797 dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation), Bureau 
of Civil Aviation Security for the purpose of securing the safety of aircraft 
operation, directs that the following orders shall be implemented with immediate 
effect: 
 
(i) 
In order to perform legitimate functions at the airport, no 
Airport Entry Pass* shall be issued to a person unless 
he/she successfully attends the Aviation Security Awareness 
Training Programme during last one year. 
 
(ii) 
Aviation Security Awareness Training Programme shall be 
organized by the Airport Operator at each airport in the 
country as per instructions in force. 
 
(iii) 
No person, engaged in aviation security functions, shall be 
issued Airport Entry Pass* (AEP) unless he/she successfully 
attends the specified aviation security course as per the 
National Civil Aviation Security Training Programme. 
 
* 
Airport Entry Pass (AEP) means an identity  bearing 
document issued by the Appropriate Authority for a specified 
period to a bonafide person who has legitimate functions at the 
airport(s) in the country and it does not include a temporary airport 
permit. 
 
 
( R.C. Tayal ) 
 Commissioner of Security (CA)
